docs.lead_paragraph: The White House on Monday batted back calls by Democrats and Republicans alike for President Obama to immediately step up his profile in the health care debate to either reframe it and/or reclaim it.

headline.main: White House Defends Obama's Visibility on Health Care Debate

docs.abstract: Robert Gibbs, the president's spokesman, defends the role the president has taken on his top agenda matter in the wake of mounting concerns among Democrats and criticisms from Republicans.
docs.snippet: Robert Gibbs, the president's spokesman, defends the role the president has taken on his top agenda matter in the wake of mounting concerns among Democrats and criticisms from Republicans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medical tort reform is moving to the fore of the health care debate. On Sunday in The New York Times, former Senator Bill Bradley, Democrat of New Jersey, argued that one way to gain support of both Democrats and Republicans might be to combine universal coverage with tort reform. Mr. Bradley also suggested that medical courts with special judges could be established, similar to bankruptcy or admiralty courts.
docs.abstract: Frivolous malpractice lawsuits and excessive jury awards are not significantly adding to health care costs, says a prominent tort-reform critic.
docs.snippet: Frivolous malpractice lawsuits and excessive jury awards are not significantly adding to health care costs, says a prominent tort-reform critic.

docs.lead_paragraph: Much of the national discussion on health care has focused on the need to expand coverage to those without insurance. But a new study from the U.C.L.A. Center for Health Policy Research underscores the limits of the current system in protecting even insured people from the financial risk of being sick.

headline.main: 1 in 7 Californians Have Medical Debt, Study Finds

docs.abstract: A study by the UCLA Center for Health Policy Research underscores the limits of the current health insurance system in protecting even insured people from the financial risk of being sick.
docs.snippet: A study by the UCLA Center for Health Policy Research underscores the limits of the current health insurance system in protecting even insured people from the financial risk of being sick.

docs.lead_paragraph: The man who is set to take the A.F.L.-C.I.O.'s helm next month warned Democrats on Monday that organized labor would challenge those who ultimately supported insurance companies in the push for a health care overhaul.

headline.main: Incoming A.F.L.-C.I.O. Chief Warns Democrats Not to Side With Insurers

docs.abstract: The man who is set to take the A.F.L.-C.I.O.'s helm next month warned Democrats on Monday that organized labor would challenge those who ultimately support insurance companies in the push for a health care overhaul.
docs.snippet: The man who is set to take the A.F.L.-C.I.O.'s helm next month warned Democrats on Monday that organized labor would challenge those who ultimately support insurance companies in the push for a health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama returned from Martha's Vineyard on Sunday night, and will spend much of his time before Labor Day pretty much on vacation by heading later this week to Camp David.

headline.main: The Early Word: The Close of Summer

docs.abstract: While the president continues his vacation this week, others take up the health care debate.
docs.snippet: While the president continues his vacation this week, others take up the health care debate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Premiums would rise, the Congressional Budget Office estimated, but many beneficiaries would see total drug spending decline.

headline.main: Health Bill Would Cut Drug Spending for Many on Medicare, Budget Office Says
headline.print_headline: Health Bill Would Cut Drug Spending for Many on Medicare, Budget Office Says

docs.snippet: Premiums would rise, the Congressional Budget Office estimated, but many beneficiaries would see total drug spending decline.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Nixon era, leaders in both political parties were capable of speaking rationally, and decisions weren’t as warped by corporate cash as they are now.
docs.snippet: In the Nixon era, leaders in both political parties were capable of speaking rationally, and decisions weren’t as warped by corporate cash as they are now.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama may have a better chance of achieving his health policy goals than surface impressions of the Congressional recess indicate.

headline.main: Stronger Prospects for the President on a Health Care Bill
headline.print_headline: Stronger Prospects For the President On a Health Care Bill

docs.snippet: President Obama may have a better chance of achieving his health policy goals than surface impressions of the Congressional recess indicate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Facing financial troubles and a union lawsuit, the owners of Café des Artistes decided to close the Upper West Side restaurant.

headline.seo: Owners of Struggling Café des Artistes Decide to Close
headline.main: Downturn Catches Up to Cafe Frozen in Time
headline.print_headline: Downturn Catches Up To Cafe Frozen in Time

docs.snippet: Facing financial troubles and a union lawsuit, the owners of Café des Artistes decided to close the Upper West Side restaurant.
